Detailed Description

Class that interacts with COB files (c1 and c2 formats)

COB::AddBlock ( COBBlock $  block  )

Definition at line 95 of file COB.php.

COB::COB ( IReader $  reader = null  ) 

Creates a new COB file If you want to create a COB file from scratch, simply don't pass anything to the constructor. Alternatively, if you know which kind of COB file you are reading, or only want to deal with a specific kind of COB file, you can call the LoadC1COB and LoadC2COB functions after creating a blank cob file. E.g. ($reader is a IReader) $cob = new COB; $cob->LoadC1COB($reader); This code will only parse C1 cobs.

Parameters:
$reader The reader which contains the cob to read from. Can be null.

Definition at line 37 of file COB.php.

COB::Compile ( $  format = null  ) 

Compiles the COB in the given format

Parameters:
$format The format of the COB. If null, assumed it's a creatures 2 COB

Definition at line 166 of file COB.php.

COB::GetBlocks ( $  type = false  ) 

Accessor method to get blocks of the given type If $type is false, will return all blocks in this agent. In a C1 COB, there is only one block and it is of the agnt type.

Parameters:
$type The type of block to get (agnt, auth, file). False by default. return An array of COBBlocks.

Definition at line 134 of file COB.php.

COB::LoadC1COB ( IReader $  reader  ) 

Loads a C1 COB from the specified reader C1 COBs have just one block, which is a COBAgentBlock. This is accessible by calling COB::GetBlocks

Parameters:
$reader the reader to load from

Definition at line 83 of file COB.php.

COB::LoadC2COB ( IReader $  reader  ) 

Loads a C2 COB from the IReader given C2 COBs have multiple blocks, which are accessible via the COB::GetBlocks function.

Parameters:
$reader The IReader to load from

Definition at line 68 of file COB.php.

COB::LoadCOB ( IReader $  reader  )  [private]

Loads the COB from the IReader. Used internally, this function is not for the general public! This function first identifies which type of COB is in the IReader Then decompresses if necessary, then calls LoadC1COB or LoadC2COB.

Parameters:
$reader The reader to read from

Definition at line 48 of file COB.php.

COB::ReadBlock ( $  reader  )  [private]

Underlying block reader used by C2 COBs Reads a block from the specified reader, then instanitates a representative COBBlock, and returns it.
